```{r load corpus, include=F}
# Load Corpus
m_corpus <- get_m_corpus("../../4_data/m_corpus.csv")  %>%
  select(speaker,
         mode,
         prompt,
         utt_mean_f0)

```


### LME model analysis using initial model
```{r}
# set current equation
cur_equation  <- formula(utt_mean_f0 ~ mode
                         + (1 + mode | speaker)
                         + (1 | prompt)
                         )

```

```{r fig.height=3, fig.width=9, message = F, tidy = T}
utt_mean_f0_mdl = lmer(
  formula(cur_equation),
  data = m_corpus,
  control = lmerControl(
    optimizer = "optimx",
    calc.derivs = F,
    optCtrl = list(
      method = "nlminb",
      starttests = F,
      kkt = F
    )
  )
)

# model needs trimming
m_corpus.trimmed <- m_corpus %>% filter(abs(scale(resid(utt_mean_f0_mdl))) <= 2.9)

utt_mean_f0_mdl = lmer(
  formula(cur_equation),
  data = m_corpus.trimmed,
  control = lmerControl(
    optimizer = "optimx",
    calc.derivs = F,
    optCtrl = list(
      method = "nlminb",
      starttests = F,
      kkt = F
    )
  )
)

summariseLME(utt_mean_f0_mdl, run_step = T,
              write="../output_model_anovas/utt_f0_anova.csv")
```


```{r fig.height=2.5, fig.width=5, results="asis"}
utt_mean_f0.tidy <- analyseModel(
  utt_mean_f0_mdl,
  write="../output/utt_f0"
)
utt_mean_f0.tidy$table
```

```{r random effect of prompt, fig.height=2, fig.width=5}
plot_model(utt_mean_f0_mdl,
           type="re",
           axis.title = c("semitones", "prompt"),
           show.values = T)[2]
```
